relevant_findings.Case 1: Physical and neurologic findings were essentially within normal limits, but the patient had difficulty following commands and poor tandem gait.
relevant_findings.Case 2: Physical and neurological examinations were within normal limits, although coordination and gait were mildly impaired.
relevant_findings.Case 3: Physical examination was normal, but mild graphesthesia, lack of peripheral cerebral dominance, choreoathetotic movements, and errors on reverse tandem gait were found.

changes_over_time.Case 2: Jeff's temper tantrums and 'catastrophic rage reactions' decreased markedly, and his peer interactions increased after treatment.
changes_over_time.Case 3: Joe's eccentric manner of relating and 'odd' speech were present at an attenuated level after treatment.
